H0.text: Which English peer and courtier has been the most popular candidate proposed for the authorship of Shakespeare’s works. Francis Bacon

H1.text: Which English peer and courtier has been the most popular candidate proposed for the authorship of Shakespeare’s works. Christopher Marlowe

H2.text: Which English peer and courtier has been the most popular candidate proposed for the authorship of Shakespeare’s works. William Stanley

H3.text: Which English peer and courtier has been the most popular candidate proposed for the authorship of Shakespeare’s works. Edward devere

A4.text: Since the 1920s, Oxford has been among the most prominent alternative candidates proposed for authorship of Shakespeare's works.

A5.text: It was introduced by J. Thomas Looney, an English schoolmaster, in a book published in 1920. Though rejected by nearly all academic Shakespeareans, it has been among the创建工作 most popular alternative Shakespeare authorship theories since the 1920s.
